  • View page source

ops

Note

When specifying the parameters for op in the tasks, we do not need to include the parameters current_params and current_vars because those parameters are automatically injected into the op function by the task_executor.tasks.Task. However, that also means that when defining a new op function in task_executor.ops, we need to make sure that the function includes those parameters in the definition.

task_executor.ops.abort(current_params, current_variables)[source]

Abort the task

Raises:

Exception –

task_executor.ops.assign(var_name, value, current_params, current_variables)[source]

Assigns the indicated value to a variable with name var_name

Parameters:

  • var_name (str) – Name of the variable to assign the value to

  • value (any) – Value to assign to that variable

Returns:

A dictionary with { var_name: value }

task_executor.ops.check_value(var_name, value, check_name, current_params, current_variables)[source]

Check if the value of var_name matches the one indicated, and return the result in check_name.

Parameters:

  • var_name (str) – Name of the variable to check the value of

  • value – The value to check

  • check_name (str) – The name of the variable containing the check result

Returns:

A dictionary with { check_name: var_name == value }

task_executor.ops.decrement(var_name, current_params, current_variables)[source]

Decrements the value of variable var_name in the current_variables. The value must exist and must be an integer.

Parameters:

var_name (str) – Name of the variable to decrement

Returns:

A dictionary with { var_name: var_name-1 }

task_executor.ops.get_index(var_name, idx_name, idx, current_params, current_variables)[source]

Assuming that var_name is an indexable array / dict, return the desired idx from within the array

Parameters:

  • var_name (str) – Name of the variable to get the index from

  • idx_name (str) – Name of the output variable to contain the indexed item

  • idx (int, str) – The desired index in var_name. Can be int or str

Returns:

A dictionary with { idx_name: var_name[idx] }

task_executor.ops.increment(var_name, current_params, current_variables)[source]

Increments the value of variable var_name in the current_variables. The value must exist and must be an integer.

Parameters:

var_name (str) – Name of the variable to decrement

Returns:

A dictionary with { var_name: var_name+1 }

task_executor.ops.make_boolean(var_name, bool_name, current_params, current_variables)[source]

Make the value of a variable in the current variables a boolean.

Parameters:

  • var_name (str) – Name of the variable to binarize

  • bool_name (str) – Name of the binarized version of the variable

Returns:

A dictionary with { bool_name: bool(var_name) }

task_executor.ops.negate(var_name, negate_name, current_params, current_variables)[source]

Negate the current value of var_name => not var_name

Parameters:

  • var_name (str) – Name of the variable to negate

  • negate_name (str) – Name of the variable to contain the negation

Returns:

A dictionary with { negate_name: not var_name }

task_executor.ops.noop(current_params, current_variables)[source]

Does nothing

task_executor.ops.print_var(var_name, current_params, current_variables)[source]

Print the variable with var_name

Parameters:

var_name (str) – Name of the variable to print
